newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Safilo Q1 97 sales rise 43 pct.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Safilo Q1 97 sales rise 43 pct.

text.p: Italian spectacle frame maker Safilo said turnover in the first quarter of 1997 rose 43.3 percent to 195 billion lire from 136 billion lire in the same 1996 period.

Safilo said in a statement that turnover in the first three months would have been up, against market trends, even without taking account of its 1996 acquisitions of Smith Sport Optics of the U.S. and Carrera-Optyl of Austria, which produced a combined turnover of 50 billion lire in the first quarter.

Safilo saw 1996 consolidated pre-tax profit rise 30 percent to 44.2 billion lire on group turnover of 560 billion lire, up 35 percent on 1995. It earlier this year said turnover in the first two months of 1997 had grown 46 percent.
